tldr.bestFor: Quick browser-based editing and simple exports when 720p is enough
tldr.notFor: Anyone who needs watermark-free output without paying, or expects easy refunds
tldr.why: Free exports are watermarked and capped at 720p, and refund terms are case-by-case

miniTest.prompt: Create a 30-45 second video about [topic] for [audience]. Include a 1-sentence hook, 3 key points, and a CTA. Add captions, keep pacing tight, and export in the highest available resolution for my plan

checklist.label: Edit responsiveness
checklist.value: User reports: can lag on longer projects

miniTest.verdict: Result: partial. Biggest friction was lag/billing/watermark. If you need clean 1080p/4K and no watermark, plan on upgrading and re-exporting

useCases.title: YouTube Shorts
useCases.why: Fast captions + MP4 export, but Free adds a watermark

keyFeatures: Free exports always include visible VEED.IO watermark
Export resolution depends on plan: 720p/1080p/up to 4K
Export formats include MP4, MP3, and GIF
Upgrading later requires re-exporting the original project
Refunds are considered case-by-case; pro-rata if VEED ends contract
Auto-subtitle generation with manual editing support

pros: Official help clearly confirms watermark behavior on Free exports
Clear resolution tiers across Free, Lite, Pro/Enterprise
Multiple export formats: MP4, MP3, and GIF
Re-export guidance after upgrading is explicitly documented
Refund terms exist in official terms of sale
cons: Free exports are watermarked, no exceptions
User reports: billing transparency and refunds can be painful
User reports: editor may lag or break on longer videos
Upgrading requires re-exporting to remove watermark from existing projects

verdict.bottomLine: Veed.io is best for creators who need quick browser-based editing with timeline control and caption tools. The trade-off is cost: free exports are watermarked at 720p, and removing watermarks or accessing higher resolutions requires a paid plan plus re-exporting. User reports suggest billing and cancellation processes can be frustrating.

faqs.question: Do free exports include a watermark?
faqs.answer: Yes—exports made on a free account have a visible VEED.IO watermark. If you need no watermark, you must export again on a paid plan.

faqs.question: What export resolution do plans support?
faqs.answer: Official help states Free exports in 720p only, Lite up to 1080p, and Pro/Enterprise up to 4K. Your available export options depend on your plan tier.

faqs.question: What formats can I export?
faqs.answer: You can export projects as MP4, MP3 (audio-only), or GIF. Choose the format at download time.

faqs.question: If I upgrade, can I remove the watermark from an old video?
faqs.answer: You can remove it only by exporting the original project again after upgrading. Upgrading does not retroactively change already-exported files.

faqs.question: How does the refund policy work?
faqs.answer: Refunds are considered case-by-case under the terms of sale. Pro-rata refunds are referenced specifically if VEED ends the contract.

faqs.question: Is VEED usable for commercial projects?
faqs.answer: Commercial rights typically come with paid subscriptions. Check official VEED terms for definitive coverage for your use case.

faqs.question: Is there a maximum video length on the Free plan?
faqs.answer: Export limits may apply on the Free plan. Check official VEED documentation for current limits.

faqs.question: How do AI video generation credits work?
faqs.answer: AI features may consume credits based on usage. Check your plan's documentation for specific credit allocations and per-video costs.

faqs.question: Does VEED include stock audio/video?
faqs.answer: Paid plans may include access to stock media libraries. Verify current plan features on the official pricing page.

faqs.question: What browser or system is recommended?
faqs.answer: VEED is browser-based. Modern browsers like Chrome are recommended for best performance and feature compatibility.

faqs.question: How do I cancel to stop future renewals?
faqs.answer: Manage auto-renewal settings in your workspace billing dashboard. Check official help docs for exact steps and timing.

faqs.question: Why do some users complain about lag or broken features?
faqs.answer: User reports: projects can become unstable or features may stop working without warning. Longer videos may increase stability issues. Try Chrome and ensure a stable internet connection.

veed.io.howToVerify: Visit official VEED website and pricing page
